original_fears: Student loan debt and financial stress
current_fears: Struggling to prioritize assignments and study effectively
Worrying about repaying loans while managing academic workload
Freezing up in lectures and not participating, leading to poor performance
Uncertainty about future career due to academic struggles
current_challenges: Feeling isolated and stressed without family support
Balancing part-time work and studies to reduce debt
current_behaviors: Pulling all-nighters to catch up on assignments
Relying on quick meals due to time constraints
Delaying work until the last minute, increasing stress
current_anxiety_triggers: Feeling overwhelmed and unable to participate in big classes

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Lisa expressed frustration with coursework stress and freezing up in lectures. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: For coursework, breaking tasks into smaller chunks and active learning; for lectures, scripting questions, using the 5-second rule, and prepping flexible backups. 3) Student's response to solutions: Initially skeptical but agreed to try scripting questions and starred terms, and adopted time management techniques. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Lisa committed to testing the strategies in the next two lectures and noted the practicality of the solutions, showing openness to change.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Overwhelm with coursework and procrastination, 2) Anxiety in large lectures leading to participation freeze, 3) Frustration with lack of progress. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Chunking assignments and active learning techniques, 2) Scripting questions and using the 5-second rule for participation, 3) Prepping backup questions and starring key terms for improvisation. Student's response to solutions: Initially skeptical but agreed to test scripting and the 5-second rule, showing a pragmatic shift. Evidence of progress/improvement: Commitment to trying new strategies, willingness to document failures, and reduced anxiety level from 6/10 to 5.5/10.

For lectures, scripting questions, using the 5-second rule, and prepping backup questions were proposed. 3) Student's response to solutions: Lisa agreed to try scripting questions and using starred terms for improvisation, showing openness to concrete strategies. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Lisa's willingness to implement these tactics in the next two lectures indicates initial progress in addressing her participation anxiety.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Overwhelm with coursework and poor time management, 2) Freezing up in large lectures and inability to participate. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Breaking coursework into smaller chunks and using active learning techniques, 2) Scripting questions and using the 5-second rule to participate in lectures. Student's response to solutions: Initially skeptical but agreed to try scripting questions and using starred terms for improvisation. Evidence of progress/improvement: Student committed to testing the two-question approach and noted the practicality of the solution, showing willingness to engage with the strategies despite initial resistance.
